title: Aphrodite's Child - 666 (remastered and restored by }{eywood)
description:
Aphrodite's Child
666
remastered and restored by }{eywood


I had the vinyl LP of this for many years and always felt it to be one of the greatest prog rock albums ever made.  Unfortunately the mastering left something to be desired.  When it was released on CD there were some edits made that shortened the album.  This brought it down to 80 minutes, presumably to fit it on one CD, but the CD release, strangely, was 2 CDs.  The editing wasn't necessary after all.

So I took the CD and recut most of the missing bits back into the sequence from the LP.  I also remastered the whole thing, removing noise and beefing up the low end which was sadly lacking on all releases.  Partially this is because of a rather crappy job of recording the bass guitar, but mostly it was from too conservative mastering.  Worst part is the bass level was different from song to song, and was particularly lacking in Babylon. Now this thing has punch.

The only parts of the editing I left from the CD version are the segue from Seven Trumpets to Altamont and the crossfade from Loud Loud Loud into The Four Horsemen.   For Loud/Horsemen it just flowed better with an overlap, whereas on the album the two are nearly, but not quite,  separated.  As for Seven Trumpets, on the original the voice says "...the music changes!" and there is an abrupt cut to "this is the sight we had one day on the high mountain", followed by the fade in of Altamont.  On the CD the high mountain bit is cut and the Altamont fade in begins as "the music changes" is spoken, presenting a much better segue between the tracks.  This is the only good decision the editors of the CD made, and I kept it that way.

01 The System
02 Babylon
03 Loud Loud Loud
04 The Four Horsemen
05 The Lamb
06 The Seventh Seal
07 Aegian Sea
08 Seven Bowls
09 The Wakening Beast
10 Lament
11 The Marching Beast
12 The Battle of the Locusts
13 Do It
14 Tribulation
15 The Beast
16 Ofis
17 Seven Trumpets
18 Altamont
19 The Wedding of the Lamb
20 The Capture of the Beast
21 Infinity
22 Hic Et Nunc
23 All The Seats Were Occupied
24 Break
